text: Ruben Armand "Benny" Mardones (November 9, 1946 â€“ June 29, 2020) was an American pop singer-songwriter. He was known for his hit single "Into the Night," which hit the Top 20 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart twice, in 1980 (#11) and again in 1989 (#20). He was born in Cleveland, Ohio. Mardones died on June 29, 2020 at his home in Menifee, California from Parkinson's disease- related problems, aged 73. ==References== Category:1946 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from Parkinson's disease Category:American singer- songwriters Category:American rock singers Category:American pop singers Category:Singers from Cleveland Category:Writers from Cleveland
